1{-# LANGUAGE PatternSynonyms #-}
2{-# OPTIONS_GHC -Wall #-}
3
4-- | Shorthand types and functions.
5
6module Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Shorthand
7 ( -- * Derived types
8   Pair, Twin,
9   Bs, Bz,
10   pattern Jp,
11   pattern Jp2,
12   pattern Jp3,
13
14   -- * Functions
15   ordEq, compareOn,
16   int, integer,
17   nothing,
18 ) where
19
20import qualified Data.ByteString                as Bs
21import qualified Data.ByteString.Lazy           as Bz
22import qualified Koshucode.Baala.Overture.Type  as O
23
24
25-- ============================================  Types
26
27-- | Nominal pair type.
28type Pair a b = (a, b)
29
30-- | Twin pair.
31type Twin a = (a, a)
32
33-- | Strict bytestring.
34type Bs = Bs.ByteString
35
36-- | Lazy bytestring.
37type Bz = Bz.ByteString
38
39-- | Just pair: __Jp /a b/__ is equal to __Just (/a/, /b/)__.
40pattern Jp a b = Just (a, b)
41
42-- | Double just pairs: __Jp2 /a b c/__ is equal to __Just (/a/, Just (/b/, /c/))__.
43pattern Jp2 a b c = Just (a, Just (b, c))
44
45-- | Triple just pairs: __Jp3 /a b c d/__ is equal to __Just (/a/, Just (/b/, Just (/c/, /d/)))__.
46pattern Jp3 a b c d = Just (a, Just (b, Just (c, d)))
47
48
49-- ============================================  Function
50
51-- | Test equality using 'Ord' method.
52--   This function can be used for implementing 'Eq' instance.
53--
54--   > instance Eq X where
55--   >   (==) = ordEq
56--
57ordEq :: (Ord a) => a -> a -> Bool
58ordEq x y = (x `compare` y) == EQ
59
60-- | @compareOn@ /f/ /x/ /y/ comapres /f x/ and /f y/
61--   instead of /x/ and /y/.
62--
63--   >>> compareOn length "foo" "bar"
64--   EQ
65--
66compareOn :: (Ord b) => (a -> b) -> a -> a -> Ordering
67compareOn f x y = f x `compare` f y
68
69-- | 'Int' shorthand.
70--
71--   >>> int 12
72--   12
73--
74--   This is same as:
75--
76--   >>> 12 :: Int
77--   12
78--
79{-# INLINE int #-}
80int :: O.Map Int
81int = id
82
83-- | 'Integer' shorthand.
84--
85--   >>> integer 12
86--   12
87--
88--   This is same as:
89--
90--   >>> 12 :: Integer
91--   12
92--
93{-# INLINE integer #-}
94integer :: O.Map Integer
95integer = id
96
97-- | Function which always returns 'Nothing'.
98--
99--   >>> nothing True :: Maybe String
100--   Nothing
101--
102nothing :: a -> Maybe b
103nothing _ = Nothing
